heading: UPSC Civil Services Examination – India’s Premier Administrative Exam
subHeading: Prepare for IAS, IPS, IFS, and allied services with a structured, stage-wise learning approach.
quickIntro: The UPSC Civil Services Examination (CSE) is conducted annually by the Union Public Service Commission to recruit officers for top administrative positions in the Government of India. The exam tests a candidate’s knowledge, analytical ability, ethics, and leadership potential through a three-stage selection process.

stages.description: Objective screening test consisting of two papers: General Studies Paper I and CSAT.
Descriptive written examination consisting of qualifying and merit-ranking papers.
Face-to-face assessment of personality traits such as leadership, integrity, judgment, and communication skills.

servicesOffered: Other Group A and Group B Central Services

eligibility.education: Bachelor’s degree from a recognized university
eligibility.ageLimit: 21 to 32 years (relaxations applicable for reserved categories)
eligibility.nationality: Indian (specific services have additional nationality criteria)
